input.content:
Filter the following raw HTML state into a clean observation via code based on the task. State:
Switch between the tabs to find and click on the link "odio".

Nisi aliquam nisl donec. Elementum. Sit aenean at tellus, vulputate ultrices egestas nibh ac. Neque curabitur viverra in vitae, eu.

Nam maecenas diam. Scelerisque integer augue at cursus ut diam arcu nulla. Quis. Elit mauris. A malesuada. Arcu congue nunc.

Semper id dolor et. Quis augue viverra. Aliquet. Cras pulvinar quis. Facilisis enim. Placerat hendrerit vitae et quam diam. Pellentesque.

Phasellus nisi, fermentum arcu,. Nec rhoncus sagittis. At turpis est gravida proin sit eleifend sed volutpat ullamcorper felis at faucibus.

Pellentesque duis commodo. Non lobortis. Pellentesque euismod odio dolor. Imperdiet diam. Lacus,. At commodo congue. Amet, id. Amet, dolor non.

Laoreet magna purus nunc, vitae, vulputate. At. Metus morbi urna malesuada risus eu et viverra. Bibendum. Sed molestie. In. Mi.

If the link is in multiple tabs, you only need to find one of the tabs. Keep the clean observation in a string variable `obs` in this format: 'Click on the link "xxx" in Tab #1/#2/#3'. The string of the raw state is already in the variable `state` so do not repeat the state in the code. Here are some examples: Write code within three backticks '```' to Switch between the tabs to find and click on the link "integer.". Code: ```python from bs4 import BeautifulSoup # parse the HTML state soup = BeautifulSoup(state, 'html.parser') # Find all tab content divs tabs = soup.find_all('div', {'class': 'ui-tabs-panel'}) for idx, tab in enumerate(tabs, 1): if tab.find('span', string="integer."): obs = f'Click on the link "integer." in Tab #{idx}' break ``` Write code within three backticks '```' to Switch between the tabs to find and click on the link "morbi". Code: ```python from bs4 import BeautifulSoup # parse the HTML state soup = BeautifulSoup(state, 'html.parser') # Find all tab content divs tabs = soup.find_all('div', {'class': 'ui-tabs-panel'}) for idx, tab in enumerate(tabs, 1): if tab.find('span', string="morbi"): obs = f'Click on the link "morbi" in Tab #{idx}' break ``` Now, write code within three backticks '```' to Switch between the tabs to find and click on the link "odio". Code:

output:
```python
from bs4 import BeautifulSoup
# parse the HTML state
soup = BeautifulSoup(state, 'html.parser')
# Find all tab content divs
tabs = soup.find_all('div', {'class': 'ui-tabs-panel'})
for idx, tab in enumerate(tabs, 1):
    if tab.find('span', string="odio"):
        obs = f'Click on the link "odio" in Tab #{idx}'
        break
```

input.content:
Observation:
Click on the link "integer." in Tab #2
Action:

```
agent.click_xpath("//*[@href='#tabs-2']")  # Switch to Tab #2
agent.click_xpath("(//*[@id='tabs-2']/p/span[text()='integer.'])[1]")  # Click on the link 'integer.'
```

```
agent.click_xpath("(//*[@id='tabs-1']/p/span[text()='morbi'])[1]")  # Click on the link 'morbi'
```
